gurmukhi: ੴ> ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ||
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankaar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ੧ ਮੰਗਲਾਚਰਨ
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankaar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਚਾ ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹ ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹਾ ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹੁ ਸਿਰੰਦਾ
transliteration: Satigur Sachaa Paatisaahu Paatisaahaa Paatisaahu Sirandaa.
translation: The true Guru is true emperor and He is creator of the emperor of the emperors.

gurmukhi: ਸਚੈ ਤਖਤਿ ਨਿਵਾਸੁ ਹੈ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਚਖੰਡਿ ਵਸੰਦਾ
transliteration: Sachai Takhati Nivaasu Hai Saadhasangati Sach Khandi Vasandaa.
translation: He sits on the throne of truth and resides in holy congregation, the abode of truth.

gurmukhi: ਸਚੁ ਫੁਰਮਾਣੁ ਨੀਸਾਣੁ ਸਚੁ ਸਚਾ ਹੁਕਮੁ ਨ ਮੂਲਿ ਫਿਰੰਦਾ
transliteration: Sachu Phuramaanu Neesaanu Sachu Sachaa Houkamu N Mooli Dhirandaa.
translation: Truth is His mark and truth He utters and His command is irrefutable.

gurmukhi: ਸਚੁ ਸਬਦੁ ਟਕਸਾਲ ਸਚੁ ਗੁਰ ਤੇ ਗੁਰ ਹੁੲਿ ਸਬਦ ਮਿਲੰਦਾ
transliteration: Sachu Sabadu Takasaal Sachu Gur Tay Gur Hui Sabad Miladaa.
translation: He whose Word is true and whose treasure is true, is attainable in the form of the word of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਸਚੀ ਭਗਤਿ ਭੰਡਾਰ ਸਚੁ ਰਾਗ ਰਤਨ ਕੀਰਤਨੁ ਭਾਵੰਦਾ
transliteration: Sachee Bhagati Bhandaar Sachu Raag Ratan Keeratanu Bhaavandaa.
translation: His devotion is true, His warehouse is true and He likes love and praise.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਚਾ ਪੰਥੁ ਹੈ ਸਚੁ ਦੋਹੀ ਸਚੁ ਰਾਜੁ ਕਰੰਦਾ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Sachaa Pandu Hai Sachu Dohee Sachu Raaju Karandaa.
translation: The way of the gurmukhs is also true, their slogan is truth and their kingdom is also the kingdom of truth.

gurmukhi: ਵੀਹਿ ੲਿਕੀਹ ਚੜ੍ਹਾੳੁ ਚੜ੍ਹੰਦਾ ||੧||
transliteration: Veeh Ikeeh Charhhaau Charhhandaa ?1?
translation: The treader on this path, crossing the world goes on to meet the Lord.

gurmukhi: ੨ ੳੁਹੋ ਹੀ
translation: Invocation

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਪਰਮੇਸਰੁ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਸਚੇ ਸਚਾ ਨਾੳੁ ਧਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gur Paramaysaru Jaaneeai Sachay Sachaa Naau Dharaaiaa.
translation: The Guru ought to be known as the Supreme Lord because only that true being has adopted the true name (of the Lord).

gurmukhi: ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰੁ ਅਾਕਾਰੁ ਹੋੲਿ ੲੇਕੰਕਾਰ ਅਪਾਰੁ ਸਦਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Nirankaaru Aakaaru Hoi Aykankaaru Apaaru Sadaaiaa.
translation: The formless Lord has made His self known in the form of Ekaiikar, the one boundless Being.

gurmukhi: ੲੇਕੰਕਾਰਹੁ ਸਬਦ ਧੁਨਿ ਓਅੰਕਾਰਿ ਅਕਾਰੁ ਬਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Aykankaarahu Sabad Dhouni Aoankaari Akaaru Banaaiaa.
translation: From Ekanka came up Oankar, the Word vibration which further came to be known as the world, full of names and forms.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕਦੂ ਹੋੲੇ ਤਿਨ ਦੇਵ ਤਿਹੁਂ ਮਿਲਿ ਦਸ ਅਵਤਾਰ ਗਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Ikadoo Hoi Tini Dayv Tihu Mili Das Avataar Ganaaiaa.
translation: From the one Lord came out three gods (Brahma-, Visnu and Mahes'a) who further got themselves counted among the ten incarnations (of the supreme Being).

gurmukhi: ਅਾਦਿ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਅਾਦੇਸੁ ਹੈ ਓਹੁ ਵੇਖੈ ਓਨ੍ਹਾ ਨਦਰਿ ਨ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Aadi Purakhu Aadaysu Hai Aohu Vaykhai Aonhaa Nadari N Aaiaa.
translation: I salute this primal Being who sees them all but is Himself invisible.

gurmukhi: ਸੇਖ ਨਾਗੁ ਸਿਮਰਣੁ ਕਰੈ ਨਾਵਾਂ ਅੰਤੁ ਬਿਅੰਤੁ ਨ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Saykh Naag Simaranu Karai Naavaa Antu Biantu N Paaiaa.
translation: The mythical snake (Sesanag) recites and remembers Him through His myriad names but even then knows nothing about His ultimate extent.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਚੁ ਨਾੳੁ ਮਨਿ ਭਾੲਿਅਾ ||੨||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Sachu Naau Mani Bhaaiaa ?2?
translation: The true name of same Lord is loved by gurmukhs.

gurmukhi: ੩ ੲੀਸ਼੍ਵਰੀ ੳੁਸਤਤਿ
translation: Praises of the Wondrous Guru  the Lord

gurmukhi: ਅੰਬਰੁ ਧਰਤਿ ਵਿਛੋੜਿਅਨੁ ਕੁਦਰਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਕਰਤਾਰ ਕਹਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Anbaru Dharati Vichhorhianu Kudarati Kari Karataar Kahaaiaa.
translation: God has stabilized earth and sky separately and for His this power He is known as the creator.

gurmukhi: ਧਰਤੀ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਪਾਣੀਅੈ ਵਿਣੁ ਥੰਮਾਂ ਅਾਗਾਸੁ ਰਹਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Dharatee Andari Paaneeai Vinu Danmaan Aagaasu Rahaaiaa.
translation: He has settled earth in water and without props the sky He has placed in a stable position.

gurmukhi: ੲਿੰਨ੍ਹਣ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਅਗਿ ਧਰਿ ਅਹਿਨਿਸ ਸੂਰਜੁ ਚੰਦੁ ੳੁਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Innhan Andari Agi Dhari Ahinisi Sooraju Chandu Oupaaiaa.
translation: Putting fire in the fuel He has created sun and moon shining day and night.

gurmukhi: ਛਿਅ ਰੁਤਿ ਬਾਰਹਮਾਹ ਕਰਿ ਖਾਣੀ ਬਾਣੀ ਚਲਤੁ ਰਚਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Chhia Routi Baarah Maah Kari Khaanee Baanee Chalatu Rachaaiaa.
translation: Making six seasons and twelve months He has undertaken the sport of creating four mines and four speeches.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਣਸ ਜਨਮੁ ਦੁਲੰਭੁ ਹੈ ਸਫਲੁ ਜਨਮੁ ਗੁਰੁ ਪੂਰਾ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Maanas Janamu Dulabhu Hai Saphalu Janamu Guru Pooraa Paaiaa.
translation: Human life is rare and whosoever has found the perfect Gum, his life has become blessed.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਸਹਜਿ ਸਮਾੲਿਅਾ ||੩||
transliteration: Saadhasangati Mili Sahaji Samaaiaa ?3?
translation: Meeting the holy congregation man is absorbed in equipoise.

gurmukhi: ੪ ੳੁਹੋ ਹੀ
translation: Benevolence of the true Guru

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਸਚੁ ਦਾਤਾਰੁ ਹੈ ਮਾਣਸ ਜਨਮੁ ਅਮੋਲੁ ਦਿਵਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Satiguru Sachu Daataaru Hai Maanas Janamu Amolu Divaaiaa.
translation: The true Guru is truly benevolent as he has granted us the human life.

gurmukhi: ਮੂਹੁ ਅਖੀ ਨਕੁ ਕੰਨੁ ਕਰਿ ਹਥ ਪੈਰ ਦੇ ਚਲੈ ਚਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Moohu Akhee Naku Kannu Kari Had Pair Day Chalai Chalaaiaa.
translation: Mouth, eyes, nose, ears He created and has given feet so that the individual could move around.

gurmukhi: ਭਾੳੁ ਭਗਤਿ ੳੁਪਦੇਸੁ ਕਰਿ ਨਾਮੁ ਦਾਨੁ ੲਿਸਨਾਨੁ ਦਿੜਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Bhaau Bhagati Oupadaysu Kari Naamu Daanu Isanaanu Dirhaaiaa.
translation: Preaching loving devotion, the true Guru has bestowed on the people steadfastness in remembering the Lord, ablution and charity.

gurmukhi: ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਵੇਲੈ ਨਾਵਣਾ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਜਪੁ ਗੁਰਮੰਤੁ ਜਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Anmrit Vaylai Naavanaa Guramoukhi Japu Guramantu Japaaiaa.
translation: In ambrosial hours the gurmukhs undertake to inspire themselves and others to bathe and recite the mantra of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਤ ਅਾਰਤੀ ਸੋਹਿਲਾ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਵਿਚਿ ੳੁਦਾਸੁ ਰਹਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Raati Aaratee Sohilaa Maaiaa Vichi Udaasu Rahaaiaa.
translation: In the evening, instructing the recitation of Arati and Sohild, the true Guru has inspired people to remain detached even amidst maya.

gurmukhi: ਮਿਠਾ ਬੋਲਣੁ ਨਿਵਿ ਚਲਣੁ ਹਥਹੁ ਦੇੲਿ ਨ ਅਾਪੁ ਗਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Mitdaa Bolanu Nivi Chalanu Hadahu Dayi N Aapu Ganaaiaa.
translation: The Guru has preached people to speak mildly, to conduct themselves humbly and to not to get noticed even after giving something to others.

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰਿ ਪਦਾਰਥ ਪਿਛੈ ਲਾੲਿਅਾ ||੪||
transliteration: Chaari Padaarad Pichhai Laaiaa ?4?
translation: This way the true Guru has made all the four ideals (dharma, arch, Wm and moks) of life to follow him.

gurmukhi: ੫ ਗੁਰ ੳੁਸਤਤਿ
translation: Praises of the Guru

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਵਡਾ ਅਾਖੀਅੈ ਵਡੇ ਦੀ ਵਡੀ ਵਡਿਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Satiguru Vadaa Aakheeai Vaday Dee Vadee Vadiaaee.
translation: The true Guru is called great and the glory of the great is also great.

gurmukhi: ਓਅੰਕਾਰਿ ਅਕਾਰੁ ਕਰਿ ਲਖ ਦਰੀਅਾੳੁ ਨ ਕੀਮਤਿ ਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Aoankaari Akaaru Kari Lakh Dareeaau N Keemati Paaee.
translation: Oankar has assumed the form of the world and millions of life-streams could not know about His grandeur.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕ ਵਰਭੰਡੁ ਅਖੰਡੁ ਹੈ ਜੀਅ ਜੰਤ ਕਰਿ ਰਿਜਕੁ ਦਿਵਾੲੀ
transliteration: Ik Varabhandu Akhandu Hai Jeea Jant Kari Rijaku Divaaee.
translation: The One Lord uninterruptedly is pervading the whole universe and provides livelihood to all creatures.

gurmukhi: ਲੂੰਅ ਲੂੰਅ ਵਿਚਿ ਰਖਿਓਨੁ ਕਰਿ ਵਰਭੰਡ ਕਰੋੜਿ ਸਮਾੲੀ
transliteration: Looa Looa Vichi Rakhiaonu Kari Varabhand Karorhi Samaaee.
translation: That Lord has subsumed crores of universes in His each trichome.

gurmukhi: ਕੇਵਡੁ ਵਡਾ ਅਾਖੀਅੈ ਕਵਣ ਥਾੳੁ ਕਿਸੁ ਪੁਛਾ ਜਾੲੀ
transliteration: Kayvadu Vadaa Aakheeai Kavan Daau Kisu Pouchhaan Jaaee.
translation: How His expanse may be explained and whom should one ask as to where He resides.

gurmukhi: ਅਪੜਿ ਕੋੲਿ ਨ ਹੰਘੲੀ ਸੁਣਿ ਸੁਣਿ ਅਾਖਣ ਅਾਖਿ ਸੁਣਾੲੀ
transliteration: Aparhi Koi N Hanghaee Souni Souni Aakhan Aakhi Sounaaee.
translation: None can reach Him; all talk about Him is on the basis of hearsay.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਮੂਰਤਿ ਪਰਗਟੀ ਅਾੲੀ ||੫||
transliteration: Satiguru Moorati Paragatee Aaee ?5?
translation: That Lord has become manifest in the form of the true Guru.

gurmukhi: ੬ ਗੁਰ ੳੁਸਤਤਿ
translation: Praises of the Guru

gurmukhi: ਧਿਅਾਨੁ ਮੂਲੁ ਗੁਰ ਦਰਸਨੋ ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮੁ ਜਾਣਿ ਜਾਣੋੲੀ
transliteration: Dhiaanu Moolu Gur Darasano Pooran Brahamu Jaani Jaanoee.
translation: The glimpse of the Guru is the basis of meditation because Guru is Brahm and this fact is known to a rare one.

gurmukhi: ਪੂਜ ਮੂਲ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਚਰਣ ਕਰਿ ਗੁਰਦੇਵ ਸੇਵ ਸੁਖ ਹੋੲੀ
transliteration: Pooj Mool Satiguru Charan Kari Guradayv Sayv Soukh Hoee.
translation: The feet of true Guru, the root of all delights, should be worshipped and only then the delight would be atttained.

gurmukhi: ਮੰਤ੍ਰ ਮੂਲੁ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਬਚਨ ੲਿਕ ਮਨਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਅਰਾਧੈ ਕੋੲੀ
transliteration: Mantr Moolu Satiguru Bachan Ik Mani Hoi Araadhai Koee.
translation: The instructions of the true Guru is the basic formula (mantra) whose adoration with single minded devotion is undertaken by rare one.

gurmukhi: ਮੋਖ ਮੂਲੁ ਕਿਰਪਾਲੁ ਗੁਰੁ ਜੀਵਨੁ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਿ ਸੋੲੀ
transliteration: Mokh Moolu Kirapaa Guroo Jeevanu Moukati Saadh Sangi Soee.
translation: The basis of liberation is the grace of the Guru and one attains liberation in life in the holy congregation alone.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪੁ ਗਣਾੲਿ ਨ ਪਾੲੀਅੈ ਅਾਪੁ ਗਵਾੲਿ ਮਿਲੈ ਵਿਰਲੋੲੀ
transliteration: Aapu Ganaai N Paaeeai Aapu Gavaai Milai Viraloee.
translation: Making oneself noticed none can attain the Lord and even shedding the ego any rare one meets Him.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪੁ ਗਵਾੲੇ ਅਾਪ ਹੈ ਸਭ ਕੋ ਅਾਪਿ ਅਾਪੇ ਸਭੁ ਕੋੲੀ
transliteration: Aapu Gavaaay Aap Hai Sabh Ko Aapi Aapay Sabhu Koee.
translation: He who annihilates his ego, in fact, is the Lord Himself; he knowns everyone as his form and all accept him as their form.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਚੇਲਾ ਚੇਲਾ ਗੁਰੁ ਹੋੲੀ ||੬||
transliteration: Guru Chaylaa Chaylaa Guru Hoee ?6?
translation: This way that individual in the form of Guru becomes disciple and the disciple is turned to be Guru.

gurmukhi: ੭ ਚਾਰ ਜੁਗਾਂ ਦੇ ਧਰਮ
translation: Conduct of the four Ages

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਜੁਗਿ ਪਾਪ ਕਮਾਣਿਅਾ ੲਿਕਸ ਪਿਛੈ ਸਭ ਦੇਸੁ ਦੁਖਾਲਾ
transliteration: Satijoug Paap Kamaaniaa Ikas Pichhai Daysu Doukhaalaa.
translation: In satyug, the whole country suffered due to the evil deeds of even one individual.

gurmukhi: ਤ੍ਰੇਤੈ ਨਗਰੀ ਪੀੜੀਅੈ ਦੁਅਾਪੁਰਿ ਪਾਪੁ ਵੰਸੁ ਕੋ ਦਾਲਾ
transliteration: Traytai Nagaree Peerheeai Duaapuri Paapu Vansu Ko Daalaa.
translation: In tretayug, the evil committed by one, made the whole city suffer and in dvapar the whole family underwent the pains.

gurmukhi: ਕਲਿਜੁਗਿ ਬੀਜੈ ਸੋ ਲੁਣੈ ਵਰਤੈ ਧਰਮ ਨਿਅਾੳੁ ਸੁਖਾਲਾ
transliteration: Kalijougi Beejai So Lounai Varatai Dharam Niaau Soukhaalaa.
translation: Simple is the justice of kaliyug; here only he reaps who sows.

gurmukhi: ਫਲੈ ਕਮਾਣਾ ਤਿਹੁ ਜੁਗੀ ਕਲਿਜੁਗਿ ਸਫਲੁ ਧਰਮੁ ਤਤਕਾਲਾ
transliteration: Phalai Kamaanaa Tihu Jougeen Kalijougi Saphalu Dharamu Tatakaalaa.
translation: In other three yugs, the fruit of the action was earned and accumulated but in kaliyug, one gets the fruit of dharma immediately.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਪ ਕਮਾਣੈ ਲੇਪੁ ਹੈ ਚਿਤਵੈ ਧਰਮ ਸੁਫਲੁ ਫਲਵਾਲਾ
transliteration: Paap Kamaanai Laypu Hai Chitavai Dharam Suphalu Phal Vaalaa.
translation: Somethin* happens only after doing something in the kaliyug but even the thought of dharma gives the happy fruit in it.

gurmukhi: ਭਾੲਿ ਭਗਤਿ ਗੁਰਪੁਰਬ ਕਰਿ ਬੀਜਨਿ ਬੀਜੁ ਸਚੀ ਧਰਮਸਾਲਾ
transliteration: Bhaai Bhagati Gurapurab Kari Beejani Beeju Sachee Dharamasaalaa.
translation: The gurmukhs, contemplating on the wisdom of Guru and the loving devotion, sow the seed in earth, the true abode of truth.

gurmukhi: ਸਫਲ ਮਨੋਰਥ ਪੂਰਣ ਘਾਲਾ ||੭||
transliteration: Saphal Manorad Pooran Ghaalaa ?7?
translation: They succeed in their practice and objective.

gurmukhi: ੮ ਕਲਿਜੁਗ ਦਾ ਧਰਮ
translation: Conduct in the Kaliyug

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਜੁਗਿ ਸਤਿ ਤ੍ਰੇਤੈ ਜੁਗਾ ਦੁਅਾਪਰਿ ਪੂਜਾ ਬਹਲੀ ਘਾਲਾ
transliteration: Satijougi Sati Traytai Jougaa Duaapari Poojaa Bahalee Ghaalaa.
translation: In satyug the truth, in treta and dvapar worship and ascetice discipline were in vogue.

gurmukhi: ਕਲਿਜੁਗਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਨਾੳੁ ਲੈ ਪਾਰਿ ਪਵੈ ਭਵਜਲ ਭਰਨਾਲਾ
transliteration: Kalijougi Guramoukhi Naaoun Lai Paari Pavai Bhavajal Bharanaalaa.
translation: The gurmukhs, in kaliyug go across the world-ocean by repeating the name of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰਿ ਚਰਣ ਸਤਿਜੁਗੈ ਵਿਚਿ ਤ੍ਰੇਤੈ ਚੳੁਥੈ ਚਰਣ ੳੁਕਾਲਾ
transliteration: Chaari Charan Satijougai Vichi Traytai Chaudai Charan Oukaalaa.
translation: Dharma had four feet in the satyug but in treta, the fourth foot of dharma was made cripple.

gurmukhi: ਦੁਅਾਪੁਰਿ ਹੋੲੇ ਪੈਰ ਦੁੲਿ ੲਿਕਤੈ ਪੈਰ ਧਰੰਮੁ ਦੁਖਾਲਾ
transliteration: Duaapuri Hoay Pair Dui Ikatai Pair Dharanmu Doukhaalaa.
translation: In dvapar only two feet of dharma survived and in kaliyug the dharma stands only on one foot to undergo the sufferings.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਣੁ ਨਿਮਾਣੈ ਜਾਣਿ ਕੈ ਬਿਨੳੁ ਕਰੈ ਕਰਿ ਨਦਰਿ ਨਿਹਾਲਾ
transliteration: Maanu Nimaanai Jaani Kai Binau Karai Kari Nadari Nihaalaa.
translation: Considering the Lord as the strength of the powerless ones, it (dharma) started praying for the liberation through the grace of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਪੂਰੈ ਪਰਗਾਸੁ ਕਰਿ ਧੀਰਜੁ ਧਰਮ ਸਚੀ ਧਰਮਸਾਲਾ
transliteration: Gur Poorai Paragaasu Kari Dheeraju Dharam Sachee Dharamasaalaa.
translation: The Lord manifesting in the form of the perfect Gum created the true abode of fortitude and the dharma.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪੇ ਖੇਤ ਅਾਪੇ ਰਖਵਾਲਾ ||੮||
transliteration: Aapay Khaytu Aapay Rakhavaalaa ?8?
translation: Himself is the field (of creation) and Himself its protector.

gurmukhi: ੯ ਜਿੱਤ ਕੇ ਹਾਰਨਾ
translation: Winning by losing

gurmukhi: ਜਿਨ੍ਹਾਂ ਭਾੳੁ ਤਿਨ ਨਾਹਿ ਭੳੁ ਮੁਚੁ ਭੳੁ ਅਗੈ ਨਿਭਵਿਅਾਹਾ
transliteration: Jinhaan Bhaau Tin Naahi Bhau Mouchu Bhau Agai Nibhaviaahaa.
translation: They are not scared of anybody who have cherished the love of the Lord and those who are devoid of the fear of Lord remain scared in the court of Lord.

gurmukhi: ਅਗਿ ਤਤੀ ਜਲ ਸੀਅਲਾ ਨਿਵ ਚਲੈ ਸਿਰੁ ਕਰੈ ੳੁਤਾਹਾ
transliteration: Agi Tatee Jal Seealaa Niv Chalai Siru Karai Outaahaa.
translation: Since it keeps its head high, the fire is hot and because the water flows downwards, it is cold.

gurmukhi: ਭਰਿ ਡੁਬੈ ਖਾਲੀ ਤਰੈ ਵਜਿ ਨ ਵਜੈ ਘੜੈ ਜਿਵਾਹਾ
transliteration: Bhari Doubai Khaalee Tarai Vaji N Vajai Gharhai Jivaahaa.
translation: The filled up pitcher drowns and makes no sound and the empty one not only goes on swimming, it rather makes the noise also (likewise is the egotist and the egoless one, the latter absorbing in loving devotion gets liberated and the former goes on tossing

gurmukhi: ਅੰਬੁ ਸੁਫਲ ਫਲਿ ਝੁਕਿ ਲਹੈ ਦੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਅਰੰਡੁ ਨ ਨਿਵੈ ਤਲਾਹਾ
transliteration: Anb Suphal Phali Jhouki Lahai Doukh Phalu Arandu N Nivai Talaahaa.
translation: Being full of fruits, the mango tree bends down in humility but the castor tree being full of bitter fruits never bows in humility.

gurmukhi: ਮਨੁ ਪੰਖੇਰੂ ਧਾਵਦਾ ਸੰਗਿ ਸੁਭਾੲਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਫਲ ਖਾਹਾ
transliteration: Manu Pankhayroo Dhaavadaa Sangi Soubhaai Jaai Phal Khaahaa.
translation: The mind-bird keeps flying and according to its nature picks up the fruits.

gurmukhi: ਧਰਿ ਤਾਰਾਜੂ ਤੋਲੀਅੈ ਹੳੁਲਾ ਭਾਰਾ ਤੋਲੁ ਤੁਲਾਹਾ
transliteration: Dhari Taaraajoo Toleeai Haulaa Bhaaraa Tolu Tulaahaa.
translation: On the scale of justice, the light and the heavy are weighed (and good and bad are differentiated).

gurmukhi: ਜਿਣਿ ਹਾਰੈ ਹਾਰੈ ਜਿਣੈ ਪੈਰਾ ੳੁਤੇ ਸੀਸੁ ਧਰਾਹਾ
transliteration: Jini Haarai Haarai Jinai Pairaa Outay Seesu Dharaahaa.
translation: He who looks to be winning here loses in the court of the Lord and likewise the loser here wins there.

gurmukhi: ਪੈਰੀ ਪੈ ਜਗ ਪੈਰੀ ਪਾਹਾ ||੯||
transliteration: Pairee Pai Jag Pairee Paahaa ?9?
translation: All bow at his feet. The individual first falls at the feet (of Guru) and then he makes all to fall at his feet.

gurmukhi: ੧੦ ਜੇਹਾ ਭਾੳੁ ਤੇਹਾ ਫਲ
translation: One gets what one desires

gurmukhi: ਸਚੁ ਹੁਕਮੁ ਸਚੁ ਲੇਖ ਹੈ ਸਚੁ ਕਾਰਣੁ ਕਰਿ ਖੇਲੁ ਰਚਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sachu Houkamu Sachu Laykhu Hai Sachu Kaaranu Kari Khaylu Rachaaiaa.
translation: The order of the Lord is true, His writ is true and from the true cause He has created the creation as His sport.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਰਣੁ ਕਰਤੇ ਵਸਿ ਹੈ ਵਿਰਲੈ ਦਾ ਓਹੁ ਕਰੈ ਕਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Kaaranu Karatay Vasi Hai Viralai Daa Aohu Karai Karaaiaa.
translation: All the causes are under the control of the creator but He accepts the deeds of any rare devotee.

gurmukhi: ਸੋ ਕਿਹੁ ਹੋਰੁ ਨ ਮੰਗੲੀ ਖਸਮੈ ਦਾ ਭਾਣਾ ਤਿਸੁ ਭਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: So Kihu Horu N Mangaee Khasamai Daa Bhaanaa Tisu Bhaaiaa.
translation: The devotee who has loved the will of the Lord, does not beg anything from any one else.

gurmukhi: ਖਸਮੈ ੲੇਵੈ ਭਾਵਦਾ ਭਗਤਿ ਵਛਲੁ ਹੁੲਿ ਬਿਰਦੁ ਸਦਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Khasamai Ayvai Bhaavadaa Bhagati Vachhalu Hui Biradu Sadaaiaa.
translation: Now the Lord also loves to accept the prayer of the devotee because protection of the devotee is His nature.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦੁ ਲਿਵ ਕਾਰਣੁ ਕਰਤਾ ਕਰਦਾ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Saadhasangati Gur Sabadu Liv Kaaranu Karataa Karadaa Aaiaa.
translation: The devotees who keep their consciousness absorbed in the Word in the holy congregation, know well that the creator Lord is the perennial cause of all causes.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਲ ਸੁਭਾੲਿ ਅਤੀਤ ਜਗਿ ਵਰ ਸਰਾਪ ਦਾ ਭਰਮੁ ਚੁਕਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Baal Soubhaai Ateet Jagi Var Saraap Daa Bharamu Choukaaiaa.
translation: The devotee like the innocent child remains detached from the world and keeps himself free from delusions of boons and curses.

gurmukhi: ਜੇਹਾ ਭਾੳੁ ਤੇਹੋ ਫਲੁ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ ||੧੦||
transliteration: Jayhaa Bhaau Tayho Phalu Paaiaa ?10?
translation: He receives the fruit in accordance with his desert.'

gurmukhi: ੧੧ ਅੳੁਗਣ ਦਾ ਗੁਣ ਕਰਣਾ
translation: Making of the virtue from the evil

gurmukhi: ਅੳੁਗੁਣ ਕੀਤੇ ਗੁਣ ਕਰੈ ਸਹਜਿ ਸੁਭਾੳੁ ਤਰੋਵਰ ਹੰਦਾ
transliteration: Aougoun Keetay Goun Karai Sahaji Soubhaau Tarovar Houndaa.
translation: The tree being in equipoise does good even to the evil doer.

gurmukhi: ਵਢਣ ਵਾਲਾ ਛਾੳੁ ਬਹਿ ਚੰਗੇ ਦਾ ਮੰਦਾ ਚਿਤਵੰਦਾ
transliteration: Vaddhan Vaalaa Chhaau Bahi Changay Daa Mandaa Chitavandaa.
translation: The tree cutter sits under the shade of the same and thinks evil of that benevolent one.

gurmukhi: ਫਲ ਦੇ ਵਟ ਵਗਾੲਿਅਾ ਵਢਣ ਵਾਲੇ ਤਾਰਿ ਤਰੰਦਾ
transliteration: Phal Day Vat Vagaaiaan Vaddhan Vaalay Taari Tarandaa.
translation: It gives fruits to the stone throwers and boat to the cutters to get them across.

gurmukhi: ਬੇਮੁਖ ਫਲ ਨਾ ਪਾੲਿਦੇ ਸੇਵਕ ਫਲ ਅਣਗਣਤ ਫਲੰਦਾ
transliteration: Baymoukh Phal Naa Paaiday Sayvak Phal Anaganat Phaladaa.
translation: The individuals opposed to the Gum do not get fruit and the servants receive infinite reward.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਵਿਰਲਾ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਸੇਵਕੁ ਸੇਵਕ ਸੇਵ ਕਰੰਦਾ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Viralaa Jaaneeai Sayvaku Sayvak Sayvak Sandaa.
translation: Any rare gurmukh is known in this world who serves the servants of the Lord's servants.

gurmukhi: ਜਗੁ ਜੋਹਾਰੇ ਚੰਦ ਨੋ ਸਾੲਿਰ ਲਹਰਿ ਅਨੰਦੁ ਵਧੰਦਾ
transliteration: Jagu Johaaray Chand No Saair Lahari Anadu Vadhandaa.
translation: The second day moon is saluted by all and the ocean also becoming glad throws its waves towards it.

gurmukhi: ਜੋ ਤੇਰਾ ਜਗੁ ਤਿਸ ਦਾ ਬੰਦਾ ||੧੧||
transliteration: Jo Tayraa Jagu Tis Daa Bandaa ?11?
translation: 0 Lord! the whole world becomes his who is yours own.

gurmukhi: ੧੨ ਕਮਾਦ ਦਾ ਦ੍ਰਿਸ਼ਟਾਂਤ
translation: The example of the sugarcane

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਵਿਸਮਾਦੁ ਕਮਾਦੁ ਹੈ ਸਿਰ ਤਲਵਾੲਿਅਾ ਹੋੲਿ ੳੁਪੰਨਾ
transliteration: Jiu Visamaadu Kamaadu Hai Sir Talavaaiaa Hoi Oupannaa.
translation: Nature of sugarcane is wondrous: it takes birth head down.

gurmukhi: ਪਹਿਲੇ ਖਲ ੳੁਖਲਿਕੈ ਟੋਟੇ ਕਰਿ ਕਰਿ ਭੰਨਣਿ ਭੰਨਾ
transliteration: Pahilay Khal Oukhalikai Totay Kari Kari Bhannani Bhannaa.
translation: First its skin is eeled off and it is cut into pieces.

gurmukhi: ਕੋਲੂ ਪਾੲਿ ਪੀੜਾੲਿਅਾ ਰਸ ਟਟਰਿ ਕਸ ੲਿੰਨਣ ਵੰਨਾ
transliteration: Koloo Paai Peerhaaiaa Ras Tatari Kas Innan Vannaa.
translation: Then it is crushed in cane crusher; its nice is boiled in a cauldren and the bagasse is burnt as fuel.

gurmukhi: ਦੁਖ ਸੁਖ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਸਬਰੁ ਕਰਿ ਖਾੲਿ ਅਵਟਣੁ ਜਗ ਧੰਨ ਧੰਨਾ
transliteration: Doukh Soukh Andari Sabaru Kari Khaaay Avatanu Jag Dhann Dhannaa.
translation: It remains ontented in joys and sufferings alike and after getting boiled is called est in the world.

gurmukhi: ਗੁੜੁ ਸਕਰੁ ਖੰਡੁ ਮਿਸਰੀ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਸਭ ਰਸ ਬੰਨਾ
transliteration: Gurhu Sakaru Khandu Misaree Guramoukh Soukh Phalu Sabh Ras Bannaa.
translation: Attaining the pleasure fruit, like gurmukh, it becomes he base of jaggery, sugar and crystal sugar.

gurmukhi: ਪਿਰਮ ਪਿਅਾਲਾ ਪੀਵਣਾ ਮਰਿ ਮਰਿ ਜੀਵਣੁ ਥੀਵਣੁ ਗੰਨਾ
transliteration: Piram Piaalaa Peevanaa Mari Mari Jeevanu Deevanu Gannaa.
translation: Death after quaffing the cup f love is similar to the life of sugarcane which after getting crushed becomes live.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਬੋਲ ਅਮੋਲ ਰਤੰਨਾ ||੧੨||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Bol Amol Ratannaa ?12?
translation: Sayings of gurmukhs are invaluable like jewels.

gurmukhi: ੧੩ ਗੁਰ ਦਰੀਅਾੳੁ
translation: Guru ocean

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਦਰੀਅਾੳੁ ਅਮਾੳੁ ਹੈ ਲਖ ਦਰੀਅਾੳੁ ਸਮਾੳੁ ਕਰੰਦਾ
transliteration: Gur Dareeaau Amaau Hai Lakh Dareeaau Samaau Karandaa.
translation: Guru is such an immeasurable ocean that millions of rivers are absorbed in it.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕਸ ੲਿਕਸ ਦਰੀਅਾੳੁ ਵਿਚਿ ਲਖ ਤੀਰਥ ਦਰੀਅਾੳੁ ਵਹੰਦਾ
transliteration: Ikas Ikas Dareeaau Vichi Lakh Teerad Dareeaau Vahandaa.
translation: Millions of pilgrimage centres are there on each river and in each stream millions of waves are raised by nature.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕਤੁ ੲਿਕਤੁ ਵਾਹੜੈ ਕੁਦਰਤਿ ਲਖ ਤਰੰਗ ੳੁਠੰਦਾ
transliteration: Ikatu Ikatu Vaaharhai Kudarati Lakh Tarang Outdadaa.
translation: In that Guru-ocean myriad jewels and all the four ideals (dharma, arth, kam and moks) moves around in the form of fish.

gurmukhi: ਸਾੲਿਰ ਸਣੁ ਰਤਨਾਵਲੀ ਚਾਰਿ ਪਦਾਰਥੁ ਮੀਨ ਤਰੰਦਾ
transliteration: Saair Sanu Ratanaavalee Chaari Padaaradu Meen Tarandaa.
translation: All these things are not equal even to one wave (one sentence) of the Guru-ocean.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕਤ ਲਹਰਿ ਨ ਪੁਜਨੀ ਕੁਦਰਤਿ ਅੰਤੁ ਨ ਅੰਤ ਲਹੰਦਾ
transliteration: Ikatu Lahir N Pujanee Kudarati Antu N Ant Lahandaa.
translation: The mystery of the extent of His power is unknowable.

gurmukhi: ਪਿਰਮ ਪਿਅਾਲੇ ੲਿਕ ਬੂੰਦ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਵਿਰਲਾ ਅਜਰੁ ਜਰੰਦਾ
transliteration: Piram Piaalay Ik Boond Guramoukh Viralaa Ajaru Jarandaa.
translation: The unbearable drop of the cup of love can be cherished by any rare gurmukh.

gurmukhi: ਅਲਖ ਲਖਾੲਿ ਨ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖੰਦਾ ||੧੩||
transliteration: Alakh Lakhaai N Alakhu Lakhandaa  13
translation: The Guru himself sees that imperceptible Lord, who is not visible to others.

gurmukhi: ੧੪ ੲੀਸ਼ਰ ਬੇਅੰਤ ਹੈ
translation: God is infinite

gurmukhi: ਬ੍ਹਮੇ ਥਕੇ ਬੇਦ ਪੜਿ ੲਿੰਦ੍ਰ ੲਿੰਦਾਸਣ ਰਾਜੁ ਕਰੰਦੇ
transliteration: Brahamay Dakay Bayd Parhi Indr Indaasan Raaju Karanday.
translation: Many Brahmas reciting Vedas and many Indrs ruling the kingdoms got tired.

gurmukhi: ਮਹਾਂਦੇਵ ਅਵਧੂਤ ਹੋੲਿ ਦਸ ਅਵਤਾਰੀ ਬਿਸਨੁ ਭਵੰਦੇ
transliteration: Mahaandayv Avadhoot Hoi Das Avataaree Bisanu Bhavanday.
translation: Mahadev becoming recluse and Visnu assuming ten incarnations roamed hither and thither.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਧ ਨਾਥ ਜੋਗੀਸਰਾ ਦੇਵੀ ਦੇਵ ਨ ਭੇਵ ਲਹੰਦੇ
transliteration: Sidh Naad Jogeesaraan Dayvee Dayv N Bhayv Lahanday.
translation: Siddhs, naths, chiefs of the yogis, gods and goddesses could not know the mystery of that Lord.

gurmukhi: ਤਪੇ ਤਪੀਸੁਰ ਤੀਰਥਾ ਜਤੀ ਸਤੀ ਦੇਹ ਦੁਖ ਸਹੰਦੇ
transliteration: Tapay Tapeesur Teeradaan Jatee Satee Dayh Doukh Sahanday.
translation: Ascetics, the people going to pilgrimage centres, celebates and numerous satis in order to know Him suffer through their bodies.

gurmukhi: ਸੇਖਨਾਗ ਸਭ ਰਾਗ ਮਿਲਿ ਸਿਮਰਣੁ ਕਰਿ ਨਿਤਿ ਗੁਣ ਗਾਵੰਦੇ
transliteration: Saykhanaag Sabh Raag Mili Simaranu Kari Niti Goun Gaavanday.
translation: Sesanag also along with all musical measures remembers and praises Him.

gurmukhi: ਵਡਭਾਗੀ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਜਗਿ ਸਬਦੁ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਸਤਸੰਗਿ ਮਿਲੰਦੇ
transliteration: Vadabhaagee Gurasikh Jagi Sabadu Surati Satasangi Miladay.
translation: In this world only gurmukhs are fortunate who merging their consciousness in the Word gather in holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖੰਦੇ ||੧੪||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Alakhu Lakhanday  14
translation: Gurmukhs only, become face to face with that imperceptible Lord and attain the fruit of delight.

gurmukhi: ੧੫ ਨਿੰਮ੍ਰਤਾ ਦਾ ਗੁਣ
translation: Merits of humility

gurmukhi: ਸਿਰ ਤਲਵਾੲਿਅਾ ਬਿਰਖੁ ਹੈ ਹੋੲਿ ਸਹਸ ਫਲ ਸੁਫਲ ਫਲੰਦਾ
transliteration: Sir Talavaaiaa Birakhu Hai Hoi Sahas Phal Suphal Phaladaa.
translation: The head (root) of the tree remains downwards and there for it is laden with flowers and fruit.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਰਮਲੁ ਨੀਰੁ ਵਖਾਣੀਅੈ ਸਿਰੁ ਨੀਵਾ ਨੀਵਾਣਿ ਚਲੰਦਾ
transliteration: Niramalu Neeru Vakhaaneeai Siru Neevaan Neevaani Chaladaa.
translation: The water is known as pure because it flows downward.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਰ ੳੁਚਾ ਨੀਵੇ ਚਰਣ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪੈਰੀ ਸੀਸੁ ਪਵੰਦਾ
transliteration: Siru Ouchaa Neevayn Charan Guramoukhi Pairee Seesu Pavandaa.
translation: The head is higher and the feet lower but even then the head bows on the feet of the gurmukh.

gurmukhi: ਸਭਦੂ ਨੀਵੀ ਧਰਤਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਅਨੁ ਧਨੁ ਸਭੁ ਸੈ ਸਾਰੁ ਸਹੰਦਾ
transliteration: Sabhadoo Neevee Dharati Hoi Anu Dhanu Sabhu Sai Saaru Sahandaa.
translation: The lowest is the earth which bears the burden of the whole world and of the wealth in it.

gurmukhi: ਧੰਨੁ ਧਰਤੀ ਓਹੁ ਥਾੳੁ ਧੰਨੁ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖ ਸਾਧੂ ਪੈਰੁ ਧਰੰਦਾ
transliteration: Dhannu Dharatee Aohu Daau Dhannu Guru Sikh Saadhoo Pairu Dharandaa.
translation: That land and that place is blest where the Guru, the Sikh and ..he holymen put their feet.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣ ਧੂੜਿ ਪਰਧਾਨ ਕਰਿ ਸੰਤ ਵੇਦ ਜਸੁ ਗਾਵਿ ਸੁਣੰਦਾ
transliteration: Charan Dhoorhi Paradhaan Kari Sant Vayd Jasu Gaavi Sounandaa.
translation: That the dust of the feet of the saints is the highest is told even by the Vedas.

gurmukhi: ਵਡਭਾਗੀ ਪਾਖਾਕ ਲਹੰਦਾ ||੧੫||
transliteration: Vadabhaagee Paakhaak Lahandaa  15
translation: Any fortunate one attains the dust of the feet.

gurmukhi: ੧੬ ਗੁਰੂ ਨਾਨਕ ਪੂਰਣ ਗੁਰੂ ਹੈ
translation: The perfect Guru

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰਾ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਪੂਰੇ ਪੂਰਾ ਠਾਟੁ ਬਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Pooraa Satiguru Jaaneeai Pooray Pooraa Tdaatu Banaaiaa.
translation: The perfect true Guru is known in his majestic form.

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰੇ ਪੂਰਾ ਤੋਲੁ ਹੈ ਘਟੈ ਨ ਵਧੈ ਘਟਾੲਿ ਵਧਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Pooray Pooraa Tolu Hai Ghatai N Vadhai Ghataai Vadhaaiaa.
translation: Perfect is the justice of the perfect Guru to which nothing can be added nor reduced from.

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰੇ ਪੂਰੀ ਮਤਿ ਹੈ ਹੋਰਸੁ ਪੁਛਿ ਨ ਮਤਾ ਪਕਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Pooray Pooree Mati Hai Horasu Pouchhi N Mataa Pakaaiaa.
translation: The wisdom of the perfect Guru is perfect and he makes up his mind with out asking for other's counsel .

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰੇ ਪੂਰਾ ਮੰਤੁ ਹੈ ਪੂਰਾ ਬਚਨੁ ਨ ਟਲੈ ਟਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Pooray Pooraa Mantu Hai Pooraa Bachanu N Talai Talaaiaa.
translation: The mantra of the perfect is perfect and his command cannot be avoided.

gurmukhi: ਸਭੇ ੲਿਛਾ ਪੂਰੀਅਾ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਪੂਰਾ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sabhay Ichhaa Pooreeaa Saadhasangati Mili Pooraa Paaiaa.
translation: All desires are fulfilled when joining the holy congregation, one meets the perfect Guru .

gurmukhi: ਵੀਹ ੲਿਕੀਹ ੳੁਲੰਘਿ ਕੈ ਪਤਿ ਪੳੁੜੀ ਚੜ੍ਹਿ ਨਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Veeh Ikeeh Ulaghikai Pati Paurhee Charhhi Nij Ghari Aaiaa.
translation: Crossing all calculations the Guru has climbed the ladder of honour to reach his own loft.

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰੇ ਪੂਰਾ ਹੋੲਿ ਸਮਾੲਿਅਾ ||੧੬||
transliteration: Pooray Pooraa Hoi Samaaiaa  16
translation: Becoming perfect he has merged in that perfect Lord.

gurmukhi: ੧੭ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਜਾਗਤਾ ਹੈ ਦੇਵ
translation: The true Guru is the knowing god

gurmukhi: ਸਿਧ ਸਾਧਿਕ ਮਿਲਿ ਜਾਗਦੇ ਕਰਿ ਸਿਵਰਾਤੀ ਜਾਤੀ ਮੇਲਾ
transliteration: Sidh Saadhik Mili Jaagaday Kari Sivaraatee Jaatee Maylaa.
translation: The siddhs and other performer of austerities by remaining awake celebrate the Sivaratri fair.

gurmukhi: ਮਹਾਦੇੳੁ ਅੳੁਧੂਤੁ ਹੈ ਕਵਲਾਸਣਿ ਅਾਸਣਿ ਰਸਕੇਲਾ
transliteration: Mahaadayu Audhootu Hai Kavalaasani Aasani Rasakaylaa.
translation: Mahadev is a recluse and Brahma is absorbed in the delight of the seat of lotus.

gurmukhi: ਗੋਰਖੁ ਜੋਗੀ ਜਾਗਦਾ ਗੁਰਿ ਮਾਛਿੰਦ੍ਰ ਧਰੀ ਸੁ ਧਰੇਲਾ
transliteration: Gorakhu Jogee Jaagadaa Guri Maachhindr Dharee Su Dharaylaa.
translation: That Gorakh the yogi is also awake whose teacher Machhendr had kept a beautiful concubine.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਜਾਗਿ ਜਗਾੲਿਦਾ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਵੇਲਾ
transliteration: Satiguru Jaagi Jagaaidaa Saadhasangati Mili Anmrit Vaylaa.
translation: The true Guru is awake and he in the holy congregation in ambrosial hours makes others also awake (from the sleep of infatuation).

gurmukhi: ਨਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਤਾੜੀ ਲਾੲੀਅਨੁ ਅਨਹਦ ਸਬਦ ਪਿਰਮ ਰਸਖੇਲਾ
transliteration: Nij Ghari Taarhee Laaeeanu Anahad Sabad Piram Ras Khaylaa.
translation: In the holy congregation, theji-vs concentrate upon their self and remain absorbed in the loving delight of the unstruck word.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਦਿ ਪੁਰਖ ਅਾਦੇਸ ਹੈ ਅਲਖ ਨਿਰੰਜਨ ਨੇਹੁ ਨ ਵੇਲਾ
transliteration: Aadi Purakh Aadaysu Hai Alakh Niranjan Nayhu Navaylaa.
translation: I salute the primal person, the Guru whose love and affection for the imperceptible Lord is ever fresh.

transliteration: Chaylay Tay Guru Guru Tay Chaylaa  17
translation: From disciple, the devotee becomes Guru and the Guru becomes disciple.

gurmukhi: ੧੮ ਸੱਚ ਸੱਚਾ ਹੈ, ਕੂੜ ਕੂੜਾ ਹੈ
translation: The truth is true and the false hood is false  ,

gurmukhi: ਬ੍ਹਮਾ ਬਿਸਨੁ ਮਹੇਸੁ ਤ੍ਰੈ ਸੈਸਾਰੀ ਭੰਡਾਰੀ ਰਾਜੇ
transliteration: Brahamaa Bisanu Mahaysu Trai Saisaaree Bhandaaree Raajay.
translation: Brahma Visnu and Mahesra all the three are creator, sustainer and dispenser of justice respectively.

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰਿ ਵਰਨ ਘਰਬਾਰੀਅਾ ਜਾਤਿ ਪਾਤਿ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਮੁਹਤਾਜੇ
transliteration: Chaari Varan Gharabaareeaa Jaati Paati Maaiaa Muhataajay.
translation: The house holders of all the four varnas depend upon caste-gotra the lineage and maya.

gurmukhi: ਛਿਅ ਦਰਸਨ ਛਿਅ ਸਾਸਤ੍ਰਾ ਪਾਖੰਡ ਕਰਮ ਕਰਨਿ ਦੇਵਾਜੇ
transliteration: Chhia Darasan Chhia Saasatraa Paakhandi Karam Karani Dayvaajay.
translation: People perform hypocritical rituals pretending to follow the six philosophies of six shastras.

gurmukhi: ਸੰਨਿਅਾਸੀ ਦਸ ਨਾਮ ਧਰਿ ਜੋਗੀ ਬਾਰਹ ਪੰਥ ਨਿਵਾਜੇ
transliteration: Sanniaasee Das Naam Dhari Jogee Baarah Pand Nivaajay.
translation: Likewise the sannyasis assuming ten names and yogis creating their twelve sects are moving around.

gurmukhi: ਦਹਦਿਸਿ ਬਾਰਹ ਵਾਟ ਹੋੲਿ ਪਰ ਘਰਿ ਮੰਗਨਿ ਖਾਜ ਅਖਾਜੇ
transliteration: Dahadisi Baarah Vaat Hoi Par Ghar Mangani Khaaj Akhaajay.
translation: They are all going astray in ten directions and twelve sects go on begging edibles and non edibles.

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰਿ ਵਰਨ ਗੁਰੁਸਿਖ ਮਿਲਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਅਨਹਦ ਵਾਜੇ
transliteration: Chaari Varan Guru Sikh Mili Saadhasangati Vichi Anahad Vaajay.
translation: The gursikhs of all the four varnas jointly recite and listen to the unstruck melody in the holy cangregation.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਵਰਨ ਅਵਰਨ ਹੋੲਿ ਦਰਸਨੁ ਨਾੳੁਂ ਪੰਥ ਸੁਖ ਸਾਜੇ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Varan Avaran Hoi Darasanu Naaoun Pand Soukh Saajay.
translation: Gurmukh going beyond all varnas follows the philosophy of ncim and the path of spiritual delight made for him.

gurmukhi: ਸਚੁ ਸਚਾ ਕੂੜਿ ਕੂੜੇ ਪਾਜੇ ||੧੮||
transliteration: Sachu Sachaa Koorhi Koorhay Paajay  18
translation: The truth is always true and falsehood is altogether false.

gurmukhi: ੧੯ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਮਹਿਂਮਾਂ
translation: Glory of the true Guru

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਗੁਣੀ ਨਿਧਾਨ ਹੈ ਗੁਣ ਕਰਿ ਬਖਸੈ ਅਵਗੁਣਿਅਾਰੇ
transliteration: Satigur Gounee Nidhaanu Hai Goun Kari Bakhasai Avagouniaaray.
translation: The true Guru is the store house of virtues who out of his benevolence blesses even the wicked ones.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪੂਰਾ ਵੈਦੁ ਹੈ ਪੰਜੇ ਰੋਗ ਅਸਾਧ ਨਿਵਾਰੇ
transliteration: Satiguru Pooraa Vaidu Hai Panjay Rog Asaadh Nivaaray.
translation: The true Guru is a perfect physician who cures all the five chronic ailments.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਖ ਸਾਗਰੁ ਗੁਰੁਦੇੳੁ ਹੈ ਸੁਖ ਦੇ ਮੇਲਿ ਲੲੇ ਦੁਖਿਅਾਰੇ
transliteration: Soukh Saagaru Gurudayu Hai Nidak Dokhee Baymoukh Taaray.
translation: Guru is ocean of pleasures who happily absorbs in him the sufferers.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਪੂਰਾ ਨਿਰਵੈਰੁ ਹੈ ਨਿੰਦਕ ਦੋਖੀ ਬੇਮੁਖ ਤਾਰੇ
transliteration: Gur Pooraa Niravairu Hai Soukh Day Mayli Laay Doukhiaaray.
translation: The perfect Guru is away form enmity and He liberates even the slanderers, envious ones and the apostates.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਪੂਰਾ ਨਿਰਭੳੁ ਸਦਾ ਜਨਮ ਮਰਣ ਜਮ ਡਰੈ ੳੁਤਾਰੇ
transliteration: Guru Pooraa Nirabhau Sadaa Janam Maran Jam Darai Outaaray.
translation: The perfect Guru is fearless who always dispels the fear of transmigration and Yama, the god of death.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਸੁਜਾਣੁ ਹੈ ਵਡੇ ਅਜਾਣ ਮੁਗਧ ਨਿਸਤਾਰੇ
transliteration: Satiguru Purakhu Sujaanu Hai Vaday Ajaan Mougadh Nisataaray.
translation: The true Guru is that enlightened one who saves ignorant fools and even the unknown ones.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਅਾਗੂ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਬਾਹ ਪਕੜਿ ਅੰਧਲੇ ੳੁਧਾਰੇ
transliteration: Satiguru Aagoo Jaaneeai Baah Pakarhi Anphalay Udhaaray.
translation: The true Guru is known as such a leader who catching hold from the arm takes the blind also across (the world ocean).

gurmukhi: ਮਾਣੁ ਨਿਮਾਣੇ ਸਦ ਬਲਿਹਾਰੇ ||੧੯||
transliteration: Maanu Nimaanay Sad Balihaaray  19
translation: I am sacrifice unto that true Guru who is the pride of the humble ones

gurmukhi: ੨੦ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ
translation: The true Guru

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪਾਰਸਿ ਪਰਸਿਅੈ ਕੰਚਨੁ ਕਰੈ ਮਨੂਰ ਮਲੀਣਾ
transliteration: Satiguru Paarasi Parasiai Kanchanu Karai Manoor Maleenaa.
translation: The true Guru is such a philosopher's stone by whose touch dross transforms into gold.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਬਾਵਨੁ ਚੰਦਨੋ ਵਾਸੁ ਸੁਵਾਸੁ ਕਰੈ ਲਾਖੀਣਾ
transliteration: Satiguru Baavanu Chandano Vaasu Suvaasu Karai Laakheenaa.
translation: The true Guru is that sandalwood which makes every thing fragrant and million times more precious .

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪੂਰਾ ਪਾਰਿਜਾਤੁ ਸਿੰਮਲੁ ਸਫਲੁ ਕਰੈ ਸੰਗਿ ਲੀਣਾ
transliteration: Satiguru Pooraa Paarijaatu Sinmalu Saphalu Karai Sangi Leenaa.
translation: The true Guru is that wish fulfilling tree which makes the cotton silk tree full of fruit.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਨ ਸਰੋਵਰੁ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੂ ਕਾਗਹੁ ਹੰਸ ਜਲਹੁ ਦੁਧੁ ਪੀਣਾ
transliteration: Maan Sarovaru Satiguroo Kaagahu Hansu Jalahu Dudhu Peenaa.
translation: The true Guru is that Manasarovar, the sacred lake in Hindu mythology, which transforms crows into swans, who drink milk cut of mixtrue of water and milk.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਤੀਰਥੁ ਦਰੀਅਾੳੁ ਹੈ ਪਸੂ ਪਰੇਤ ਕਰੈ ਪਰਬੀਣਾ
transliteration: Gur Teeradu Dareeaau Hai Pasoo Parayt Karai Parabeenaa.
translation: The Guru is that holy river which makes the animals and the ghosts knowledgeable and skilful.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਬੰਦੀਛੋੜੁ ਹੈ ਜੀਵਣ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਕਰੈ ਓਡੀਣਾ
transliteration: Satigur Bandeechhorhu Hai Jeevan Moukati Karai Aodeenaa.
translation: The true Guru is giver of freedom from bondages and makes the detached ones librated in life.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਮਨ ਅਪਤੀਜੁ ਪਤੀਣਾ ||੨੦||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Man Apateeju Pateenaa  20
translation: The wavering mind of the Guru-oriented individual becomes steadfast and full of confidence.

gurmukhi: ੨੧ ਗੁਰੂ ਨਾਨਕ ਦੇਵ
translation: Guru Nanak Dev

gurmukhi: ਸਿਧ ਨਾਥ ਅਵਤਾਰ ਸਭ ਗੋਸਟਿ ਕਰਿ ਕਰਿ ਕੰਨ ਫੜਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sidh Naad Avataar Sabh Gosati Kari Kari Kann Dharhaaiaa.
translation: In discussions he ( Guru Nanak Dev) worsted the siddhs maths and the incarnations of gods.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਬਰ ਕੇ ਬਾਬੇ ਮਿਲੇ ਨਿਵਿ ਨਿਵਿ ਸਭ ਨਬਾਬ ਨਿਵਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Baabar Kay Baabay Milay Nivi Nivi Sabh Nabaabu Nivaaiaa.
translation: Men of Babur came to Baba Nanak and the latter made them bow in humility.

gurmukhi: ਪਤਿਸਾਹਾ ਮਿਲਿ ਵਿਛੁੜੇ ਜੋਗ ਭੋਗ ਛਡਿ ਚਲਿਤੁ ਰਚਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Patisaahaa Mili Vichhurhay Jog Bhog Chhadi Chalitu Rachaaiaa.
translation: Guru Nanak met the emperors as well and becoming detached from the enjoyments and renunciation he performed a wonderful feat.

gurmukhi: ਦੀਨ ਦੁਨੀਅਾ ਦਾ ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹੁ ਬੇਮੁਹਤਾਜੁ ਰਾਜੁ ਘਰਿ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Deen Douneeaa Daa Paatisaahu Baymuhataaju Raaju Ghari Aaiaa.
translation: Self reliant king of the spiritual and the temporal world (Guru Nanak) moved around in the world.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਦਰ ਹੋੲਿ ਕੁਦਰਤਿ ਕਰੇ ੲੇਹ ਭਿ ਕੁਦਰਤਿ ਸਾਂਗੁ ਬਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Kaadar Hoi Kudarati Karay Ayh Bhi Kudarati Saangu Banaaiaa.
translation: The nature enacted a masquerade that he becoming creator created (a new way life- Sikhism).

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕਨਾ ਜੋੜ ਵਿਛੋੜਦਾ ਚਿਰੀ ਵਿਛੁੰਨੇ ਅਾਣਿ ਮਿਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Ikanaa Jorhi Vichhorhidaa Chiree Vichhounnay Aani Milaaiaa.
translation: He makes many meet, separates others and further reunites the ones separated long back.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖਾੲਿਅਾ ||੨੧||
transliteration: Saadhasangati Vichi Alakhu Lakhaaiaa  21
translation: In the holy congregation, he arranges the glimpse of the invisible Lord.

gurmukhi: ੨੨ ਗੁਰੂ ਨਾਨਕ ਦੇਵ
translation: Guru Nanak Dev

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪੂਰਾ ਸਾਹੁ ਹੈ ਤ੍ਰਿਭਵਣੁ ਜਗੁ ਤਿਸ ਦਾ ਵਣਜਾਰਾ
transliteration: Satiguru Pooraa Saahu Hai Tribhavan Jagu Tis Daa Vanajaaraa.
translation: The true Guru is a perfect banker and the three worlds are his travelling salesmen.

gurmukhi: ਰਤਨ ਪਦਾਰਥ ਬੇਸੁਮਾਰ ਭਾੳੁ ਭਗਤਿ ਲਖ ਭਰੇ ਭੰਡਾਰਾ
transliteration: Ratan Padaarad Baysoumaar Bhaau Bhagati Lakh Bharay Bhandaaraa.
translation: He has the treasure of infinite jewels in the form of loving devotion.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਿਜਾਤ ਲਖ ਬਾਗ ਵਿਚਿ ਕਾਮਧੇਣੁ ਦੇ ਵਗ ਹਜਾਰਾ
transliteration: Paarijaat Lakh Baag Vichi Kaamadhaynu Day Vag Hajaaraa.
translation: In his garden, he keeps millions of wishfulfilling trees and thousands of herds of wishfulfilling cows.

gurmukhi: ਲਖਮੀਅਾਂ ਲਖ ਗੋਲੀਅਾਂ ਪਾਰਸ ਦੇ ਪਰਬਤੁ ਅਪਾਰਾ
transliteration: Lakhameeaan Lakh Goleeaan Paaras Day Parabatu Apaaraa.
translation: He has millions of Laksamts as servants and many mountains of philosopher's stones.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਲਖ ੲਿੰਦ੍ਰ ਲੈ ਹੁੲਿ ਸਕੇ ਛਿੜਕਨਿ ਦਰਬਾਰਾ
transliteration: Lakh Anmrit Lakh Indr Lai Hui Sakai Chhirhakani Darabaaraa.
translation: Millions of Indrs having millions types of nectars sprinkle in his court.

gurmukhi: ਸੂਰਜ ਚੰਦ ਚਰਾਗ ਲਖ ਰਿਧਿ ਸਿਧਿ ਨਿਧਿ ਬੋਹਲ ਅੰਬਾਰਾ
transliteration: Sooraj Chand Charaag Lakh Ridhi Sidhi Nidhi Bohal Anbaaraa.
translation: Millions of lamps like suns and moons are there and the heaps of miraculous powers are also with him.

gurmukhi: ਸਭੇ ਵੰਡਿ ਵੰਡਿ ਦਿਤੀਓਨ ਭਾੳੁ ਭਗਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਸਚੁ ਪਿਅਾਰਾ
transliteration: Sabhay Vand Vandi Ditiaonu Bhaau Bhagati Kari Sachu Piaaraa.
translation: The true Guru has distributed all these stores among those who love the truth and are absorbed in loving devotion.

gurmukhi: ਭਗਤਿ ਵਛਲੁ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰਾ ||੨੨||
transliteration: Bhagati Vachhalu Satiguru Nirankaaraa  22
translation: The true Guru, who himself is the Lord, loves his devotees (deeply).

gurmukhi: ੨੩ ਚੌਦਾਂ ਰਤਨ
translation: forurteen jewels

gurmukhi: ਖੀਰ ਸਮੁੰਦੁ ਵਿਰੋਲਿਕੈ ਕਢਿ ਰਤਨ ਚੳੁਦਹ ਵੰਡਿ ਲੀਤੇ
transliteration: Kheer Samoundu Viroli Kai Kaddhi Ratan Chaudah Vandi Leetay.
translation: Having churned the ocean the fourteen jewels were taken out and were distributed (among the gods and demons).

gurmukhi: ਮਣਿ੧ ਲਖਮੀ੨ ਪਾਰਜਾਤ੩ ਸੰਖੁ੪ ਸਾਰੰਗ੫ ਧਣਖੁ ਬਿਸਨੁ ਵਸਿ ਕੀਤੇ
transliteration: Mani Lakhamee Paarijaat Sankhu Saarang Dhanakhu Bisanu Vasi Keetay.
translation: Visnu got hold of gem, Laksami; wish fulfilling tree-parijat, conch, bow named sarang. .

gurmukhi: ਕਾਮਧੇਣੁ੧ ਤੇ ਅਪਛਰਾਂ੨ ਅੈਰਾਪਤਿ੩ ੲਿੰਦ੍ਰਾਸਣਿ ਸੀਤੇ
transliteration: Kaamadhaynu Tay Apachharaan Airaapati Indraasani Seetay.
translation: Wish fulfilling cow nymphs, Air5vat elephant were attached to the throne of lndr i.e. they were given him.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਲਕੂਟ੧ ਤੇ ਅਰਧ ਚੰਦੁ੨ ਮਹਾਂਦੇਵ ਮਸਤਕਿ ਧਰਿ ਪੀਤੇ
transliteration: Kaalakat Tay Aradh Chand Mahaandayv Masataki Dhari Peetay.
translation: Mahadev drank the deadly poison and adorned crescent moon on his forehead.

gurmukhi: ਘੋੜਾ੧ ਮਿਲਿਅਾ ਸੂਰਜੈ ਮਦੁ੨ ਅੰਮਿਤ੍ਰੁ੩ ਦੇਵ ਦਾਨਵ ਰੀਤੇ
transliteration: Ghorhaa Miliaa Soorajai Madu Anmritu Dayv Daanav Reetay.
translation: Sun got the horse and the wine and amrit were emptied by the gods and demons jointly .

gurmukhi: ਕਰੇ ਧਨੰਤਰੁ੧ ਵੈਦਗੀ ਡਸਿਅਾ ਤੱਛਕਿ ਮਤਿ ਬਿਪਰੀਤੇ
transliteration: Karay Dhanataru Vaidagee Dasiaa Tachhaki Mati Bipareetay.
translation: Dhanvantrt used to practise medicine but stung by Taksak, the snake, his wisdom got inverted.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ੳੁਪਦੇਸੁ ਅਮੋਲਕਾ ਰਤਨ ਪਦਾਰਥ ਨਿਧਿ ਅਗਣੀਤੇ
transliteration: Gur Oupadaysu Amolakaa Ratan Padaarad Nidhi Aganeetay.
translation: In the ocean of the teachings of the Guru, exist innumerable invaluable jewels.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਿਖਾ ਸਚੁ ਪਰੀਤੇ ||੨੩||
transliteration: Satigur Sikhaan Sachu Pareetay  23
translation: The Sikh's true love is for the Guru alone.

gurmukhi: ੨੪ ਸਿੱਖ ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ
translation: The facts about Guru Hargobind

gurmukhi: ਧਰਮਸਾਲ ਕਰਿ ਬਹੀਦਾ ੲਿਕਤ ਥਾੳੁਂ ਨ ਟਿਕੈ ਟਿਕਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Dharamasaal Kari Baheedaa Ik Daaoun N Tikai Tikaaiaa.
translation: The earlier Gurus considered that to give instructions and to preach to the people, one has to sit at one place known as dharamshala, but this Guru (Hargobind) does riot stick to one place.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹ ਘਰਿ ਅਾਵਦੇ ਗੜਿ ਚੜਿਅਾ ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹ ਚੜਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Paatisaah Ghari Aavaday Garhi Charhiaa Paatisaah Charhaaiaa.
translation: Earlier emperors would visit the house of the Guru, but this Guru has been interned by the king in a fort.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਮਤਿ ਮਹਲੁ ਨ ਪਾਵਦੀ ਨਠਾ ਫਿਰੈ ਨ ਡਰੈ ਡਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Oumati Mahalu N Paavadee Natdaa Dhirai N Darai Daraaiaa.
translation: The sarigat coming to have his glimpse cannot find him in the palace (because generally he is not available). Neither he is scared of anybody nor does he scare any one yet he is always on the move.

gurmukhi: ਮੰਜੀ ਬਹਿ ਸੰਤੋਖਦਾ ਕੁਤੇ ਰਖਿ ਸਿਕਾਰੁ ਖਿਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Manjee Bahi Santokhadaa Koutay Rakhi Sikaaru Khilaaiaa.
translation: Earlier Gurus sitting on the seat instructed people to be content but this Guru rears dogs and goes out for hunting.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਣੀ ਕਰਿ ਸੁਣਿ ਗਾਂਵਦਾ ਕਥੈ ਨ ਸੁਣੈ ਨ ਗਾਵਿ ਸੁਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Baanee Kari Souni Gaanvadaa Kadai N Sounai N Gaavi Sounaaiaa.
translation: The Gurus used to listen to Gurbani but this Guru neither recites nor (regularly) listens to hymn-singing.

gurmukhi: ਸੇਵਕ ਪਾਸ ਨ ਰਖੀਅਨਿ ਦੋਖੀ ਦੁਸਟ ਅਾਗੂ ਮੁਹਿ ਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sayvak Paas N Rakheeani Dokhee Dousat Aagoo Muhi Laaiaa.
translation: He does not keep his follower servants with him and rather maintains nearness with the wicked and the envious ones (Guru had kept Painde Khan nearby).

gurmukhi: ਸਚੁ ਨ ਲੁਕੈ ਲੁਕਾੲਿਅਾ ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਸਿਖ ਭਵਰ ਲੁਭਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sachu N Loukai Loukaaiaa Charan Kaval Sikh Bhavar Loubhaaiaa.
translation: But the truth is never concealed and that is why on the lotus feet of the Guru, the mind of 'Sikhs hover like a greedy black-bee.

gurmukhi: ਅਜਰੁ ਜਰੈ ਨ ਅਾਪੁ ਜਣਾੲਿਅਾ ||੨੪||
transliteration: Ajaru Jarai N Aapu Janaaiaa  24
translation: Guru Hargobding has borne the unbearable and he has not made himself manifest.

gurmukhi: ੨੫ ਪਿਰਮ ਸਰ ਦੁਸ਼ਤਰ ਥਾਂ ਹੈ
translation: Joy of love is attained after great hardship

gurmukhi: ਖੇਤੀ ਵਾੜਿ ਸੁ ਢਿੰਗਰੀ ਕਿਕਰ ਅਾਸ ਪਾਸ ਜਿੳੁ ਬਾਗੈ
transliteration: Khaytee Vaarhi Su Ddhingaree Kikar Aas Paas Jiu Baagai.
translation: Around the agricultural field the bushes are kept as fence and around the garden acacia. trees (for its safety) are planted.

gurmukhi: ਸਪ ਪਲੇਟੇ ਚੰਨਣੈ ਬੂਹੇ ਜੰਦ੍ਰਾ ਕੁਤਾ ਜਾਗੈ
transliteration: Sap Palaytay Channanai Boohay Jandaa Koutaa Jaagai.
translation: The sandalwood tree is entwined by snakes and for the safety of treasure the lock is used and the dog also remains awake.

gurmukhi: ਕਵਲੈ ਕੰਡੇ ਜਾਣੀਅਨਿ ਸਿਅਾਣਾ ੲਿਕੁ ਕੋੲੀ ਵਿਚਿ ਫਾਗੈ ||
transliteration: Kavalai Kanday Jaaneeani Siaanaa Iku Koee Vichi Dhaagai.
translation: Thorns are known to live near flowers and during the ho/frevelty among the turbulent crowd one or two wise men also remain persent.

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਪਾਰਸੁ ਵਿਚਿ ਪਥਰਾ ਮਣਿ ਮਸਤਕਿ ਜਿੳੁ ਕਾਲੈ ਨਾਗੈ
transliteration: Jiu Paarasu Vichi Padaraan Mani Masataki Jiu Kaalai Naagai.
translation: As the jewel remains in the head of black cobra the philosopher's stone remains surrounded by stones.

gurmukhi: ਰਤਨੁ ਸੋਹੈ ਗਲਿ ਪੋਤ ਵਿਚਿ ਮੈਗਲੁ ਬਧਾ ਕਚੈ ਧਾਗੈ
transliteration: Ratanu Sohai Gali Pot Vichi Maigalu Badhaa Kachai Dhaagai.
translation: In the garland of jewels on both the side of a jewel glass is kept to protect it and the elephant remains tied with the thread cf love.

gurmukhi: ਭਾਵ ਭਗਤਿ ਭੁਖ ਜਾੲਿ ਘਰਿ ਬਿਦਰੁ ਖਵਾਲੈ ਪਿੰਨੀ ਸਾਗੈ
transliteration: Bhaav Bhagati Bhoukh Jaai Ghari Bidaru Khavaalai Pinnee Saagai.
translation: Lord Krsna for his love for the devotees goes to Vidur's home when hungry and the latter offers him beans of sag, a green leafy vegetable.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖ ਭੳੁਰ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਹਲੰਗੁ ਸਭਾਗੈ
transliteration: Charan Kaval Guru Sikh Bhaur Saadhasangati Sahalagu Sabhaagai.
translation: The Sikh of the Guru becoming black bee of the lotus feet of the Guru, ought to attain good fortune in the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਪਿਰਮ ਪਿਅਾਲੇ ਦੁਤਰੁ ਝਾਗੈ ||੨੫||
transliteration: Param Piaalay Doutaru Jhaagai  25
translation: He should further know that cup of the love of the Lord is got after very hard

gurmukhi: ੨੬ ਮੁਰੀਦ ਮੁਰਦਾ ਗੁਰੂ ਗੋਰ
translation: The dead disciple in the Guru-grave

gurmukhi: ਭਵਜਲ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਮਾਨਸਰੁ ਸਤ ਸਮੁੰਦੀ ਗਹਿਰ ਗੰਭੀਰਾ
transliteration: Bhavajal Andari Maanasaru Sat Samoundee Gahir Ganbheeraa.
translation: Deeper than the seven seas of the world is the mental world ocean known as Manasarovar

gurmukhi: ਨਾ ਪਤਣੁ ਨ ਪਾਤਣੀ ਪਾਰਾਵਾਰੁ ਨ ਅੰਤੁ ਨ ਚੀਰਾ
transliteration: Naa Patanu Naa Paatanee Paaraavaaru N Antu N Cheeraa.
translation: Which has no wharf no boatman and no end or bound.

gurmukhi: ਨਾ ਬੇੜੀ ਨ ਤੁਲਹੜਾ ਵੰਝੀ ਹਾਥਿ ਨ ਧੀਰਕ ਧੀਰਾ
transliteration: Naa Bayrhee Naa Tulaharhaa Vanjhee Haadi N Dheerak Dheeraa.
translation: To go across it there is neither vessel nor raft; neither barge pole no any one to console.

gurmukhi: ਹੋਰੁ ਨ ਕੋੲੀ ਅਪੜੈ ਹੰਸ ਚੁਗੰਦੇ ਮੋਤੀ ਹੀਰਾ
transliteration: Horu N Koee Aparhai Hans Chouganday Motee Heeraa.
translation: None else can reach there except the swans who pick up pearls from there.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਾਂਗਿ ਵਰਤਦਾ ਪਿੰਡੁ ਵਸਾੲਿਅਾ ਫੇਰਿ ਅਹੀਰਾ
transliteration: Satiguru Saangi Varatadaa Pindu Vasaaiaa Dhayri Aheeraa.
translation: The true Guru enacts his play and populates desolate places.

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦੁ ਅਮਾਵਸ ਰਾਤਿ ਜਿੳੁ ਅਲਖੁ ਨ ਲਖੀਅੈ ਮਛੁਲੀ ਨੀਰਾ
transliteration: Chandu Amaavas Raati Jiu Alakhu N Lakheeai Machhulee Neeraa.
translation: Sometimes He hides himself like moon in amavas (no moon night) or fish in water.

gurmukhi: ਮੁੲੇ ਮੁਰੀਦ ਗੋਰਿ ਗੁਰ ਪੀਰਾ ||੨੬||
transliteration: Muay Mureed Gori Gur Peeraa  26
translation: Those who have become dead to their ego, they only absorb in the eternal trance in the from of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ੨੭ ਗੁਰ ਸਿੱਖਾਂ ਦੀ ਵੰਸ
translation: Progeny of the Sikhs of Guru

gurmukhi: ਮਛੀ ਦੇ ਪਰਵਾਰ ਵਾਂਗਿ ਜੀਵਣਿ ਮਰਣਿ ਨ ਵਿਸਰੈ ਪਾਣੀ
transliteration: Machhee Day Paravaar Vaangi Jeevani Marani N Visarai Paanee.
translation: Gursikh is like the family of fish who whether dead or alive never forgets water.

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਪਰਵਾਰੁ ਪਤੰਗ ਦਾ ਦੀਪਕ ਬਾਝੁ ਨ ਹੋਰ ਸੁਜਾਣੀ
transliteration: Jiu Paravaaru Patang Daa Deepak Baajhu N Hor Su Jaanee.
translation: Similarly to the moth family nothing but the flame of lamp is visible.

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਜਲ ਕਵਲੁ ਪਿਅਾਰੁ ਹੈ ਭਵਰ ਕਵਲ ਕੁਲ ਪ੍ਰੀਤਿ ਵਖਾਣੀ
transliteration: Jiu Jal Kavalu Piaaru Hai Bhavar Kaval Kul Preeti Vakhaanee.
translation: As the water and the lotus love each other and the tales are told of the love between the black bee and the lotus;

gurmukhi: ਬੂੰਦ ਬਬੀਹੇ ਮਿਰਗ ਨਾਦ ਕੋੲਿਲ ਜਿੳੁ ਫਲ ਅੰਬਿ ਲੁਭਾਣੀ
transliteration: Boond Babeehay Mirag Naad Koil Jiu Phal Anbi Loubhaanee.
translation: As the rain bird with the rain-drop of svati nakstr, deer with music and the nightingale with mango fruit is attached;

gurmukhi: ਮਾਨ ਸਰੋਵਰੁ ਹੰਸੁਲਾ ਓਹੁ ਅਮੋਲਕ ਰਤਨਾ ਖਾਣੀ
transliteration: Maan Sarovaru Hansulaa Aohu Amolak Ratanaa Khaanee.
translation: For swans the Manasarovar is the mine of jewels;

gurmukhi: ਚਕਵੀ ਸੂਰਜ ਹੇਤੁ ਹੈ ਚੰਦ ਚਕੋਰੈ ਚੋਜ ਵਿਡਾਣੀ
transliteration: Chakavee Sooraj Haytu Hai Chand Chakorai Choj Vidaanee.
translation: Female reddy sheldrake loves sun; Indian red legged partidge' s love with moon is praised;

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਵੰਸੀ ਪਰਮ ਹੰਸ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਹਜਿ ਸਰੋਵਰੁ ਜਾਣੀ
transliteration: Gurasikh Vansee Param Hans Satigur Sahaji Sarovaru Jaanee.
translation: Like wise, the Sikh of the Guru being the progeny of the swan of high order (paramhans) accepts the true Guru as the tank of equipoise

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਗਾੲੀ ਨੀਸਾਣੁ ਨੈਸਾਣੀ ||੨੭||
transliteration: Muragaaee Neesaanu Neesaanee  27
translation: And like a waterfowl goes to face the world ocean ( and goes across unwet).

gurmukhi: ੨੮ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖਾਂ ਦੀ ਵੰਸ
translation: Progeny of the Sikhs of Guru

gurmukhi: ਕਛੂ ਅੰਡਾ ਸੇਂਵਦਾ ਜਲ ਬਾਹਰਿ ਧਰਿ ਧਿਅਾਨੁ ਧਰੰਦਾ
transliteration: Kachhoo Andaa Saynvadaa Jal Baahari Dhari Dhiaanu Dharandaa.
translation: Tortoise hatches its eggs out side water and keeping track of those rears them up.

gurmukhi: ਕੂੰਜ ਕਰੇਂਦੀ ਸਿਮਰਣੋ ਪੂਰਣ ਬਚਾ ਹੋੲਿ ੳੁਡੰਦਾ
transliteration: Koonj Karayndee Simarano Pooran Bachaa Hoi Udandaa.
translation: By virtue of the mother's remembrance the young one of the heron bird starts flying in the sky.

gurmukhi: ਕੁਕੜੀ ਬਚਾ ਪਾਲਦੀ ਮੁਰਗਾੲੀ ਨੋ ਜਾੲਿ ਮਿਲੰਦਾ
transliteration: Koukarhee Bachaa Paaladee Muragaaee No Jaai Miladaa.
translation: The kid of waterfowl is reared up by hen but ultimately it goes to meet its mother ( waterfowl).

gurmukhi: ਕੋੲਿਲ ਪਾਲੈ ਕਾਵਣੀ ਲੋਹੂ ਲੋਹੂ ਰਲੈ ਰਲੰਦਾ
transliteration: Koil Paalai Kaavanee Lohoo Lohoo Ralai Raladaa.
translation: The offsprings of nightingale are nurtured by female crow but finally the blood goes to meet the blood.

gurmukhi: ਚਕਵੀ ਅਤੇ ਚਕੋਰ ਕੁਲ ਸਿਵ ਸਕਤੀ ਮਿਲਿ ਮੇਲੁ ਕਰੰਦਾ
transliteration: Chakavee Atay Chakor Kul Siv Sakatee Mili Maylu Karandaa.
translation: Moving around in the illusions of Siva and Sakti (maya) the female ruddy sheldrake and Indian red legged partridge also ultimately meet their beloved ones.

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦ ਸੂਰਜ ਸੇ ਜਾਣੀਅਨਿ ਛਿਅ ਰੁਤਿ ਬਾਰਹ ਮਾਹ ਦਿਸੰਦਾ
transliteration: Chand Sooraju Say Jaaneeani Chhia Routi Baarah Maah Disandaa.
translation: Among the stars, the sun and the moon are perceptible throughout the six seasons and the twelve months.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਮੇਲਾ ਸਚ ਦਾ ਕਵੀਅਾਂ ਕਵਲ ਭਵਰੁ ਵਿਗਸੰਦਾ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Maylaa Sach Daa Kaveeaan Kaval Bhavaru Vigasandaa.
translation: As the black bee is happy among lilies and lotuses,

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖੰਦਾ ||੨੮||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Alakhu Lakhandaa  28
translation: The gurmukhs get delighted to perceive the truth and attain the fruit of pleasures.

gurmukhi: ੨੯ ਦਾਵਾ ਕੋਕਾ
translation: The claim of Koka, the male nurse

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਸ ਵੰਸੀ ਹੋੲਿ ਕੈ ਸਭਨਾ ਧਾਤੂ ਮੇਲਿ ਮਿਲੰਦਾ
transliteration: Paarasavansee Hoi Kai Sabhanaa Dhaatoo Mayli Miladaa.
translation: Being of a noble family, the philosopher's stone meets all the metals (and makes them gold).

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦਨ ਵਾਸੁ ਸੁਭਾੳੁ ਹੈ ਅਫਲ ਸਫਲ ਵਿਚਿ ਵਾਸੁ ਧਰੰਦਾ
transliteration: Chandan Vaasu Soubhaau Hai Aphal Saphal Vichi Vaasu Dharandaa.
translation: The nature of the sandal is fragrant and it makes all fruitless as well as fruitful trees fragrant.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਤਰੰਗੀ ਗੰਗ ਹੋੲਿ ਨਦੀਅਾ ਨਾਲੇ ਗੰਗ ਹੋਵੰਦਾ
transliteration: Lakh Tarangee Gang Hoi Nadeeaa Naalay Gang Hovandaa.
translation: The Ganges is formeds of many tributaries but meeting the Ganges they all become Ganges.

gurmukhi: ਦਾਵਾ ਦੁਧੁ ਪੀਅਾਲਿਅਾ ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹਾ ਕੋਕਾ ਭਾਵੰਦਾ
transliteration: Daavaa Dudhu Peeaaliaa Paatisaahaa Kokaa Bhaavandaa.
translation: Koka's claim of having served as the milk giver to the king is liked by the king

gurmukhi: ਲੂਣ ਖਾੲਿ ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹ ਦਾ ਕੋਕਾ ਚਾਕਰੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਵਲੰਦਾ
transliteration: Loon Khaai Paatisaah Daa Kokaa Chaakar Hoi Valadaa.
translation: And Koka also having eaten the salt of the royal household hovers around the king to serve him.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਵੰਸੀ ਪਰਮਹੰਸੁ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖ ਹੰਸ ਵੰਸੁ ਨਿਬਹੰਦਾ
transliteration: Satigur Vansee Param Hansu Guru Sikh Hans Vansu Nibahandaa.
translation: The true Guru is of the lineage of the swans of high order and the Sikhs of the Guru also abide by the tradition of the swan family.

gurmukhi: ਪਿੳੁ ਦਾਦੇ ਦੇ ਰਾਹਿ ਚਲੰਦਾ ||੨੯||
transliteration: Pia Daaday Day Raahi Chaladaa  29
translation: Both follow the path shown by their forefathers.

gurmukhi: ੩੦ ਗੁਰੂ ਨਾਨਕ ਦੇਵ
translation: The Sikhs pass the test given by the true Guru

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਲਖ ਤਾਰੇ ਚਮਕਦੇ ਨੇੜਿ ਨ ਦਿਸੈ ਰਾਤਿ ਅਨੇਰੇ
transliteration: Jiu Lakh Taaray Chamakaday Nayrhi N Disai Raati Anayray.
translation: Despite millions of stars shine in the sky in the darkness of night yet things are not visible even if they are kept near by.

gurmukhi: ਸੂਰਜੁ ਬਦਲ ਛਾੲਿਅਾ ਰਾਤਿ ਨ ਪੁਜੈ ਦਿਹਸੈ ਫੇਰੇ
transliteration: Sooraju Badal Chhaaiaa Raati N Pujai Dihasai Dhayray.
translation: On the other hand even coming of the sun under the clouds, their shadow cann't change day into night.

gurmukhi: ਜੇ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਾਂਗਿ ਵਰਤਦਾ ਦੁਬਿਧਾ ਚਿਤਿ ਨ ਸਿਖਾਂ ਕੇਰੇ
transliteration: Jay Gur Saangi Varatadaa Doubidhaa Chiti N Sikhaan Kayray.
translation: Even if the Guru enacts any sham, the doubts are not created in the mind of the Sikhs.

gurmukhi: ਛਿਅ ਰੁਤੀ ੲਿਕੁ ਸੁਝੁ ਹੈ ਘੁਘੂ ਸੁਝ ਨ ਸੁਝੈ ਹੇਰੇ
transliteration: Chhia Routee Iku Sujhu Hai Ghoughoo Sujh N Sujhai Hayray.
translation: In all the six seasons, the same sun remains in the sky but the owl cannot see it .

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦਰਮੁਖੀ ਸੂਰਜਮੁਖੀ ਕਵਲੈ ਭਵਰ ਮਿਲਨਿ ਚੳੁਫੇਰੇ
transliteration: Chandaramoukhee Soorajamoukhee Kavalai Bhavar Milani Chaudhayray.
translation: But lotus blossoms in the sunlight as well as in the moonlit night and the black bee starts hovering around it (because they love lotus and not the sun or the, moon ).

gurmukhi: ਸਿਵ ਸਕਤੀ ਨੋ ਲੰਘਿ ਕੈ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਮਿਲਨਿ ਸਵੇਰੇ
transliteration: Siv Sakatee No Laghi Kai Saadhasangati Jaai Milani Savayray.
translation: Despite the illusive phenomena created by maya (i.e. Siva and Sakti) the Sikhs of the Guru, come to join the holy congregation in the ambrosial hours.

gurmukhi: ਪੈਰੀ ਪਵਣਾ ਭਲੇ ਭਲੇਰੇ ||੩੦||
transliteration: Pairee Pavanaa Bhalay Bhalayray  30
translation: Reaching there they touch the feet of one and all good and the better one.

gurmukhi: ੩੧ ਦੁਨਿਅਾਵੀ ਪਾਤਸ਼ਾਹ
translation: The difference between the spiritual and the temporal kings

gurmukhi: ਦੁਨੀਅਾਵਾ ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਦੇੲਿ ਮਰੈ ਪੁਤੈ ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹੀ
transliteration: Douneeaavaa Paatisaahu Hoi Dayi Marai Poutai Paatisaahee.
translation: The temporal king dies after handing over the kingdom to his son .

gurmukhi: ਦੋਹੀ ਫੇਰੈ ਅਾਪਣੀ ਹੁਕਮੀ ਬੰਦੇ ਸਭ ਸਿਪਾਹੀ
transliteration: Dohee Dhayrai Aapanee Houkamee Banday Sabh Sipaahee.
translation: He establishes his sway over the world and all his soldiers obey him.

gurmukhi: ਕੁਤਬਾ ਜਾੲਿ ਪੜਾੲਿਦਾ ਕਾਜੀ ਮੁਲਾਂ ਕਰੈ ੳੁਗਾਹੀ
transliteration: Koutabaa Jaai Parhaaidaa Kaajee Mulaan Karai Ougaahee.
translation: In the mosque he orders prayers to be said in his name and gaffs and the mullahs (spritual persons in the religious orders of Islam) testify for him.

gurmukhi: ਟਕਸਾਲੈ ਸਿਕਾ ਪਵੈ ਹੁਕਮੈ ਵਿਚਿ ਸੁਪੇਦੀ ਸਿਅਾਹੀ
transliteration: Takasaalai Sikaa Pavai Houkamai Vichi Soupaydee Siaahee.
translation: From the mint comes out the coin in his name and every right and wrong is committed at his order.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਲੁ ਮੁਲਕੁ ਅਪਣਾੲਿਦਾ ਤਖਤ ਬਖਤ ਚੜ੍ਹਿ ਬੇਪਰਵਾਹੀ
transliteration: Maalu Mulaku Apanaaidaa Takhat Bakhat Charhhi Bayparavaahee.
translation: He controlles the property and wealth of the country and sits on the throne caring for none. (However) The tradition of the House of the Guru is that the high way shown by earlier Gurus is followed .

gurmukhi: ਬਾਬਾਣੈ ਘਰਿ ਚਾਲ ਹੈ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਗਾਡੀ ਰਾਹੁ ਨਿਬਾਹੀ
transliteration: Baabaanai Ghari Chaal Hai Guramoukhi Gaadee Raahu Nibaahee.
translation: In this tradition only the one primal Lord is applauded; the mint (holy congregation) is one here;

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕ ਦੋਹੀ ਟਕਸਾਲ ੲਿਕ ਕੁਤਬਾ ਤਖਤੁ ਸਚਾ ਦਰਗਾਹੀ
transliteration: Ik Dohee Takasaal Ik Koutabaa Takhatu Sachaa Daragaahee.
translation: The sermon (of Min) is one and the true throne (the spiritual seat) is also one here.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਦਾਦਿ ੲਿਲਾਹੀ ||੩੧||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Daadi Ilaahee ?31?
translation: Justice of the Lord is such that this fruit of pleasure is given to the gurmukhs by the supreme Lord.
Miserable plight of the apostate

gurmukhi: ਜੇਕੋ ਅਾਪੁ ਗਣਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹਾਂ ਤੇ ਅਾਕੀ ਹੋਵੈ
transliteration: Jay Ko Aapu Ganaai Kai Paatisaahaan Tay Aakee Hovai.
translation: If soemeone in his pride stands opposed to the king, he is killed

gurmukhi: ਹੁੲਿ ਕਤਲਾਮੁ ਹਰਾਮੁਖੋਰ ਕਾਣੁ ਨ ਖਫਣੁ ਚਿਤਾ ਨ ਟੋਵੈ
transliteration: Hui Katalaamu Haramaakhoru Kaatdu N Khadhanu Chitaa N Tovai.
translation: And considering him a bastard pyre, coffin or grave are not available to him.

gurmukhi: ਟਕਸਾਲਹੁ ਬਾਹਰਿ ਘੜੈ ਖੋਟੈਹਾਰਾ ਜਨਮੁ ਵਿਗੋਵੈ
transliteration: Takasaalahu Baahari Gharhai Khotaihaaraa Janamu Vigovai.
translation: Out side the mint one who is coining fake coins is losing his life in vain , (because when caught he will be punished ).

gurmukhi: ਲਿਬਾਸੀ ਫੁਰਮਾਣੁ ਲਿਖਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਨੁਕਸਾਨੀ ਅੰਝੂ ਰੋਵੈ
transliteration: Libaasee Phuramaanu Likhi Hoi Noukasaanee Anjhoo Rovai.
translation: Giver of the false commands also weeps tearfully when caught.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਦੜ ਦੀ ਕਰਿ ਸਾਹਿਬੀ ਬੋਲਿ ਕੁਬੋਲੁ ਨ ਅਬਿਚਲੁ ਹੋਵੈ
transliteration: Gidarh Dee Kari Saahibee Boli Koubolu N Abichalu Hovai.
translation: A jackal pretending to be a lion may ,pose to be a commander but cannot hide his true howl (and is caught).

gurmukhi: ਮੁਹਿ ਕਾਲੈ ਗਦਹਿ ਚੜ੍ਹੈ ਰਾੳੁ ਪੜੇ ਵੀ ਭਰਿਅਾ ਧੋਵੈ
transliteration: Muhi Kaalai Gadahi Charhhai Raau Parhay Vee Bhariaa Dhovay.
translation: Similarly, the tier when caught is made to mount the ass and dust is thrown on his head . He washes himself in his tears.

gurmukhi: ਦੂਜੈ ਭਾੲਿ ਕੁਥਾੲਿ ਖਲੋਵੈ ||੩੨||
transliteration: Doojai Bhaai Kudaai Khalovai ?32?
translation: This way, the man absorbed in the duality reaches the wrong place.

gurmukhi: ੩੩ ਗੁਰੂ ਬੰਸਾਵਲੀ ਦੀ ਹੳੁਂ
translation: The ego of the Guru's progeny

gurmukhi: ਬਾਲ ਜਤੀ ਹੈ ਸਿਰੀਚੰਦੁ ਬਾਬਾਣਾ ਦੇਹੁਰਾ ਬਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Baal Jatee Hai Sireechandu Baabaanaa Dayhuraa Banaaiaa.
translation: Sirichand ( the elder son of Guru Nanak) is celebate since childhood who has constructed the monument ( in memory) of Guru Nanak.

gurmukhi: ਲਖਮੀ ਦਾਸਹੁ ਧਰਮ ਚੰਦ ਪੋਤਾ ਹੁੲਿ ਕੈ ਅਾਪੁ ਗਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Lakhameedaasahu Dharamachand Potaa Hui Kai Aapu Ganaaiaa.
translation: Dharam chand son of Laksami Das ( second son of Guru Nanak) also made display of his egotism.

gurmukhi: ਮੰਜੀ ਦਾਸੁ ਬਹਾਲਿਅਾ ਦਾਤਾ ਸਿਧਾਸਣ ਸਿਖਿ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Manjee Daasu Bahaaliaa Daataa Sidhaasan Sikhi Aaiaa.
translation: Guru Angad's one son Dasu was made to sit on the seat of Guruship and the second son Data also learnt to sit in the siddh posture i.e. both the sons of Guru Angad Dev were pretender Guru and during the time of third Guru Amar Das they tried their best to

gurmukhi: ਮੋਹਣੁ ਕਮਲਾ ਹੋੲਿਅਾ ਚੳੁਬਾਰਾ ਮੋਹਰੀ ਮਨਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Mohanu Kamalaa Hoiaa Chaoubaaraa Moharee Manaaiaa.
translation: Mohan (son of Guru Amar Das) got afflicted and Mohart (the second son) lived in a lofty house and started getting served by the people.

gurmukhi: ਮੀਣਾ ਹੋਅਾ ਪਿਰਥੀਅਾ ਕਰਿ ਕਰਿ ਟੇਢਕ ਬਰਲੁ ਚਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Meenaa Hoaa Piradeeaa Kari Kari Tonddhak Baralu Chalaaiaa.
translation: Prithichind (son of Guru Ram Das) came out as dissembling scoundrel and using his oblique nature spread his mental sickness all round.

gurmukhi: ਮਹਾਦੇੳੁ ਅਹੰਮੇੳੁ ਕਰਿ ਕਰਿ ਬੇਮੁਖੁ ਕੁਤਾ ਭੳੁਕਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Mahaadayu Ahanmayu Kari Kari Baymoukhu Poutaan Bhaoukaaiaa.
translation: Mahidev (another son of Guru Ram Das) was egotist who was also led astray.

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦਨ ਵਾਸੁ ਨ ਵਾਸ ਬੋਹਾੲਿਅਾ ||੩੩||
transliteration: Chandan Vaasu N Vaas Bohaaiaa ?33?
translation: They all were like bamboos who though lived near sandal – Guru, yet could not become fragrant.

gurmukhi: ੩੪ ਗੁਰਿਅਾੲੀ ਦੀ ਪੀੜ੍ਹੀ
translation: Lineage of the Guruship

gurmukhi: ਬਾਬਾਣੀ ਪੀੜੀ ਚਲੀ ਗੁਰ ਚੇਲੇ ਪਰਚਾ ਪਰਚਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Baabaanee Peerhee Chalee Gur Chaylay Parachaa Parachaaiaa.
translation: The line of Baia Nanak increased and the love between Guru and disciples further developed.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਅੰਗਦੁ ਗੁਰੁ ਅੰਗੁ ਤੇ ਗੁਰੁ ਚੇਲਾ ਚੇਲਾ ਗੁਰੁ ਭਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Guru Angadu Guru Angu Tay Guru Chaylaa Chaylaa Guru Bhaaiaa.
translation: Guru Angad came of the limb of Guru Nanak and the disciple became fond of Guru and the Guru of the disciple .

gurmukhi: ਅਮਰਦਾਸੁ ਗੁਰ ਅੰਗਦਹੁ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਤੇ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੂ ਸਦਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Amaradaasu Gur Angadahu Satiguru Tay Satiguroo Sadaaiaa.
translation: From Guru Ahgad came out Amar Das who was accepted Guru after Guru Angad Dev.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਅਮਰਹੁ ਗੁਰੁ ਰਾਮਦਾਸੁ ਗੁਰ ਸੇਵਾ ਗੁਰੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਸਮਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Guru Amarahu Guru Raamadaasu Gur Sayvaa Guru Hoi Samaaiaa.
translation: From Guru Amar Das came Guru Ram Das who through his service to the Guru absorbed in the Guru himself.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਮਦਾਸਹੁ ਅਰਜਣੁ ਗੁਰੂ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਬ੍ਰਿਖਿ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਫਲੁ ਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Raamadaasahu Arajanu Guroo Anmrit Brikhi Anmrit Phalu Laaiaa.
translation: From Guru Ram Das emerged Guru Arjan Dev as if from the ambrosial tree was produced ambrosia.

gurmukhi: ਹਰਗੋਵਿੰਦ ਗੁਰੁ ਅਰਜਨਹੁਂ ਅਾਦਿ ਪੁਰਖ ਅਾਦੇਸੁ ਕਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Harigovindu Guru Arajanahu Aadi Purakh Aadaysu Karaaiaa.
translation: Then from Guru Arjan Dev was born Guru Hargobind who also preached and spread the message of the primal Lord.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਝੈ ਸੁਝ ਨ ਲੁਕੈ ਲੁਕਾੲਿਅਾ ||੩੪||
transliteration: Sujhai Sujh N Loukai Loukaaiaa ?34?
translation: The sun is ever perceptible; it cannot be concealed by any one.

gurmukhi: ੩੫ ਕੁਦਰਤ ਵਰਣਨ
translation: Description of the power of the Lord

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕੁ ਕਵਾੳੁ ਪਸਾੳੁ ਕਰਿ ਓਅੰਕਾਰਿ ਕੀਅਾ ਪਾਸਾਰਾ
transliteration: Ik Kavaau Pasaau Kari Aoankaari Keeaa Paasaaraa.
translation: From one sound, the Oankar created the entire creation.

gurmukhi: ਕੁਦਰਤਿ ਅਤੁਲ ਨ ਤੋਲੀਅੈ ਤੁਲਿ ਨ ਤੋਲ ਨ ਤੋਲਣਹਾਰਾ
transliteration: Kudarati Atul N Toleeai Tuli N Tol N Tolanahaaraa.
translation: His sport of creation is immeasurable. None is there who can take its measure.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਰਿ ਸਿਰਿ ਲੇਖੁ ਅਲੇਖ ਦਾ ਦਾਤਿ ਜੋਤਿ ਵਡਿਅਾੲੀ ਕਾਰਾ
transliteration: Siri Siri Laykhu Alaykh Daa Daati Joti Vadiaaee Kaaraa.
translation: The writ has been inscribed on the forehead of each creature; light, grandeur and action are all due to His grace.

gurmukhi: ਲੇਖ ਅਲੇਖੁ ਨ ਲਖੀਅੈ ਮਸੁ ਨ ਲੇਖਣਿ ਲਿਖਣਿਹਾਰਾ
transliteration: Laykhu Alakhu N Lakheeai Masu N Laykhani Likhanihaaraa.
translation: His writ is imperceptible; the writer and His inl are also invisible.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਗ ਨਾਦ ਅਨਹਦ ਧੁਨੀ ਓਅੰਕਾਰੁ ਨ ਗਾਵਣਹਾਰਾ
transliteration: Raag Naad Anahadu Dhounee Aoankaaru N Gaavanahaaraa.
translation: Various musics, tones and rythms ate ever on but even rthen the Onkaar cannot be properly serenaded.

gurmukhi: ਖਾਣੀ ਬਾਣੀ ਜੀਅ ਜੰਤੁ ਨਾਵ ਥਾੳੁ ਅਣਗਣਤ ਅਾਪਾਰਾ
transliteration: Khaanee Baanee Jeea Jantu Naav Daav Anaganat Apaaraa.
translation: Mines, speeches, creatures names and places are infinite and uncountable.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕੁ ਕਵਾੳੁ ਅਮਾੳੁ ਹੈ ਕੇਵਡੁ ਵਡਾ ਸਿਰਜਣਹਾਰਾ
transliteration: Iku Kavaau Amaau Hai Kayvadu Vadaa Sirajanahaaraa.
translation: His one sound is beyond all limits; how expansive that creator is cannot be explained .

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰਾ ||੩੫||੨੬||
transliteration: Saadhasangati Satigur Nirankaaraa ?35?26? Chhaveeha?
translation: That true Guru , formless Lord is there and available in the holy congregation (alone)

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਸਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਬੈਰ ਨਿਰਬੈਰ ਭੲੇ ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਗੁਰ ਸਰਬ ਮੈ ਜਾਨੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Gurmati Sati Kari Bair Nirabair Bhaay , Pooran Braham Gur Sarab Mai Jaanay Hai ?
translation: Those who abide by Guru's teachings with faith and sincerity are without rancour. They carry no enmity for anyone because they have realised His presence in everybody.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਸਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਭੇਦ ਨਿਰਭੇਦ ਭੲੇ ਦੁਬਿਧਾ ਬਿਧਿ ਨਿਖੇਧ ਖੇਦ ਬਿਨਾਸਨੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Gurmati Sati Kari Bhayd Nirabhayd Bhaay , Doubidhaa Bidhi Nikhaydh Khayd Binaasanay Hai ?
translation: Those who practice the teachings of the Guru are free from discriminatory temperament. All are alike for them. The sense of dualism and attitude of condemnation of others disappear from their mind.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਸਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਬਾੲਿਸ ਪਰਮਹੰਸ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਅੰਸ ਬੰਸ ਨਿਰਗੰਧ ਗੰਧ ਠਾਨੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Gurmati Sati Kari Baais Paramahansa , Giaan Ans Bans Niragandh Gandh Tthaanay Hai ?
translation: Those crow-like dross-filled persons who adopt Guru's wisdom as truth are able to shed all the dross and become clean and pious. A miniscule of spiritual knowledge help them spread the fragrance of the Lord like Sandalwood.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਸਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਕਰਮ ਭਰਮ ਖੋੲੇ ਅਾਸਾ ਮੈ ਨਿਰਾਸ ਹੁੲਿ ਬਿਸ੍ਵਾਸ ੳੁਰ ਅਾਨੇ ਹੈ ||੨੬||
transliteration: Gurmati Sati Kari Karam Bharam Khoay , Aasaa Mai Niraas Hui Bisvaas Ur Aanay Hai ?26?
translation: Those who abide by the teachings of the Guru destroy all their doubts of rites and rituals. They become unattached with worldly desires and imbibe the intellect of the Guru in their hearts. (26)
